00007 /*
00008  * This macro uniquely defines this file as the main entry point.
00009  * There should only be one such definition in the entire project,
00010  * and this file must define the AppConfig variable as described below.
00011  */
00012 #define THIS_IS_STACK_APPLICATION
00013

00025         #define EEDATASTART_CONFIG 0x0000 // EE memory start position for config data

00040 //
00041 // PIC18 Interrupt Service Routines
00042 //
00043 // NOTE: Several PICs, including the PIC18F4620 revision A3 have a RETFIE FAST/MOVFF bug
00044 // The interruptlow keyword is used to work around the bug when using C18
00045 #if defined(__18CXX)
00046         #pragma interruptlow LowISR
00047         void LowISR(void) {
00048             TickUpdate();
00049         }
00050 
00051         #pragma interruptlow HighISR
00052         void HighISR(void){
00053             #if defined(STACK_USE_UART2TCP_BRIDGE)
00054                 UART2TCPBridgeISR();
00055                 #endif
00056         }
00057 
00058         #pragma code lowVector=0x18
00059         void LowVector(void){_asm goto LowISR _endasm}
00060 
00061         #pragma code highVector=0x8
00062         void HighVector(void){_asm goto HighISR _endasm}
00063 
00064         #pragma code // Return to default code section
00065 
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 //
00069 // Main application entry point.
00070 //
00071 
00072  void main(void) {
00073     static TICK t = 0;
00074         BOOL InitalWaitingPast = FALSE;
00075 
00076     // Initialize application specific hardware
00077     InitializeBoard();
00078 
00079         #if defined(USE_LCD)
00080                 // Initialize and display the stack version on the LCD
00081                 LCDInit();
00082                 DelayMs(100);
00083                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)LCDText, "TCPStack " VERSION "  "
00084                         "                ");
00085                 LCDUpdate();
00086         #endif
00087 
00088         // Initialize stack-related hardware components that may be
00089         // required by the UART configuration routines
00090     TickInit();
00091         #if defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2)
00092                 MPFSInit();
00093         #endif
00094 
00095         // Initialize Stack and application related NV variables into AppConfig.
00096         InitAppConfig();
00097 
00098     // Initiates board setup process if button is depressed
00099         // on startup
00100 
00101  /*
00102     if(BUTTON0_IO == 0u)
00103     {
00104                 #if (defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM) || defined(MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH)) && (defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2))
00105                 // Invalidate the EEPROM contents if BUTTON0 is held down for more than 4 seconds
00106                 TICK StartTime = TickGet();
00107                 LED_PUT(0x03);
00108 
00109                 while(BUTTON0_IO == 0u)
00110                 {
00111                         if(TickGet() - StartTime > 4*TICK_SECOND)
00112                         {
00113                                 #if defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM)
00114                             XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_CONFIG);
00115                             XEEWrite(0x00);
00116                             XEEEndWrite();
00117                             #endif
00118 
00119                                 #if defined(STACK_USE_UART)
00120                                         putrsUART("\r\n\r\nBUTTON0 held for more than 4 seconds.  Default settings restored.\r\n\r\n");
00121                                 #endif
00122 
00123                                 #if defined(STACK_USE_xPL) // JN
00124                                         xPLFactoryRestart();
00125                                 #endif
00126 
00127                                 LED_PUT(0x0F);
00128                                 Reset();
00129                                 break;
00130                         }
00131                 }
00132                 #endif
00133 
00134     }
00135 */
00136         // Initialize core stack layers (MAC, ARP, TCP, UDP) and
00137         // application modules (HTTP, SNMP, etc.)
00138     StackInit();
00139 
00140         // Now that all items are initialized, begin the co-operative
00141         // multitasking loop.  This infinite loop will continuously
00142         // execute all stack-related tasks, as well as your own
00143         // application's functions.  Custom functions should be added
00144         // at the end of this loop.
00145     // Note that this is a "co-operative mult-tasking" mechanism
00146     // where every task performs its tasks (whether all in one shot
00147     // or part of it) and returns so that other tasks can do their
00148     // job.
00149     // If a task needs very long time to do its job, it must be broken
00150     // down into smaller pieces so that other tasks can have CPU time.
00151 
00152 
00153         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00154                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n\n\n------------==============################$$$#################=============----------\r\n");
00155                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"### DEVICE STARTUP ### \r\nStack is init and ready to go, main loop starting\r\n");
00156         #endif
00157 
00158         t = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND/2ul);
00159 
00160         #if defined(STACK_USE_xPL)
00161 
00162                 // Grab a UDP socket for XPL communication
00163                 XPLSocket = UDPOpen(XPL_UDP_PORT, NULL, XPL_UDP_PORT);
00164                 if (XPLSocket == INVALID_UDP_SOCKET) {
00165                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00166                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# xPLInit failed to open UDP socket\r\n");
00167                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# Restarting device\r\n");
00168                         #endif
00169                         // Crash and die, if we can not get this socket then the show is over
00170                         Reset();
00171                 }
00172                 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00173                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPL UDP socket opened\r\n");
00174                 #endif
00175 
00176                 t = TickGet() + ( TICK_SECOND * 3);
00177             LED0_IO = 1;
00178             InitalWaitingPast = FALSE;
00179 
00180         #endif
00181 
00182 
00183 
00184 
00185     while(1)
00186     {
00187         // Blink LED0 (right most one) every second.
00188          if(TickGet() > t)
00189         {
00190             t = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND/2ul);
00191             LED0_IO ^= 1;
00192 
00193             #if defined(STACK_USE_xPL)
00194 
00195                 // We wait for a period of time to ensure that the network is stable before sending any messages.
00196                 // If we dont do this the inital xPL packet may not be received by the host
00197                         if (InitalWaitingPast == FALSE) {
00198                                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00199                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Inital waiting period completed\r\n");
00200                                         #endif
00201                                 xPLInit(); // Returns true!
00202                                 InitalWaitingPast = TRUE;
00203                         }
00204                         #endif
00205         }
00206 
00207         // This task performs normal stack task including checking
00208         // for incoming packet, type of packet and calling
00209         // appropriate stack entity to process it.
00210         StackTask();
00211 
00212         // This tasks invokes each of the core stack application tasks
00213         StackApplications();
00214 
00215                 // Process application specific tasks here.
00216                 // For this demo app, this will include the Generic TCP
00217                 // client and servers, and the SNMP, Ping, and SNMP Trap
00218                 // demos.  Following that, we will process any IO from
00219                 // the inputs on the board itself.
00220                 // Any custom modules or processing you need to do should
00221                 // go here.
00222 
00223 
00224         // If the DHCP lease has changed recently, write the new
00225         // IP address to the LCD display, UART, and Announce service
00226 
00227 
00228                 #if defined(STACK_USE_xPL)
00229                         if (InitalWaitingPast)
00230                                 XPLTasks();
00231                 #endif
00232 
00233         }
00234 }
00235 
00236 // Writes an IP address to the LCD display and the UART as available
00237 void DisplayIPValue(IP_ADDR IPVal)
00238 {
00239 //      printf("%u.%u.%u.%u", IPVal.v[0], IPVal.v[1], IPVal.v[2], IPVal.v[3]);
00240     BYTE IPDigit[4];
00241         BYTE i;
00242 #ifdef USE_LCD
00243         BYTE j;
00244         BYTE LCDPos=16;
00245 #endif
00246 
00247         for(i = 0; i < sizeof(IP_ADDR); i++)
00248         {
00249             uitoa((WORD)IPVal.v[i], IPDigit);
00250 
00251                 #if defined(STACK_USE_UART)
00252                         putsUART(IPDigit);
00253                 #endif
00254 
00255                 #ifdef USE_LCD
00256                         for(j = 0; j < strlen((char*)IPDigit); j++)
00257                         {
00258                                 LCDText[LCDPos++] = IPDigit[j];
00259                         }
00260                         if(i == sizeof(IP_ADDR)-1)
00261                                 break;
00262                         LCDText[LCDPos++] = '.';
00263                 #else
00264                         if(i == sizeof(IP_ADDR)-1)
00265                                 break;
00266                 #endif
00267 
00268                 #if defined(STACK_USE_UART)
00269                         while(BusyUART());
00270                         WriteUART('.');
00271                 #endif
00272         }
00273 
00274         #ifdef USE_LCD
00275                 if(LCDPos < 32u)
00276                         LCDText[LCDPos] = 0;
00277                 LCDUpdate();
00278         #endif
00279 }

00283 /*********************************************************************
00284  * Function:        void InitializeBoard(void)
00285  *
00286  * PreCondition:    None
00287  *
00288  * Input:           None
00289  *
00290  * Output:          None
00291  *
00292  * Side Effects:    None
00293  *
00294  * Overview:        Initialize board specific hardware.
00295  *
00296  * Note:            None
00297  ********************************************************************/
00298 static void InitializeBoard(void)
00299 {
00300         // LEDs
00301         LED0_TRIS = 0;
00302         LED1_TRIS = 0;
00303         LED2_TRIS = 0;
00304         LED3_TRIS = 0;
00305         LED4_TRIS = 0;
00306         LED5_TRIS = 0;
00307         LED6_TRIS = 0;
00308         LED_PUT(0x00);
00309 
00310 #if defined(__18CXX)
00311         // Enable 4x/5x PLL on PIC18F87J10, PIC18F97J60, etc.
00312     OSCTUNE = 0x40;
00313 
00314         // Enable internal PORTB pull-ups
00315         // is this really needed?
00316     INTCON2bits.RBPU = 0;
00317 
00318         // Configure USART
00319     TXSTA = 0x20;
00320     RCSTA = 0x90;
00321 
00322         // See if we can use the high baud rate setting
00323         #if ((GetPeripheralClock()+2*BAUD_RATE)/BAUD_RATE/4 - 1) <= 255
00324                 SPBRG = (GetPeripheralClock()+2*BAUD_RATE)/BAUD_RATE/4 - 1;
00325                 TXSTAbits.BRGH = 1;
00326         #else   // Use the low baud rate setting
00327                 SPBRG = (GetPeripheralClock()+8*BAUD_RATE)/BAUD_RATE/16 - 1;
00328         #endif
00329 
00330 
00331         // Enable Interrupts
00332         RCONbits.IPEN = 1;              // Enable interrupt priorities
00333     INTCONbits.GIEH = 1;
00334     INTCONbits.GIEL = 1;
00335 
00336 
00337 
00338 #if defined(SPIRAM_CS_TRIS)
00339         SPIRAMInit();
00340 #endif
00341 }
00342 
00343 /*********************************************************************
00344  * Function:        void InitAppConfig(void)
00345  *
00346  * PreCondition:    MPFSInit() is already called.
00347  *
00348  * Input:           None
00349  *
00350  * Output:          Write/Read non-volatile config variables.
00351  *
00352  * Side Effects:    None
00353  *
00354  * Overview:        None
00355  *
00356  * Note:            None
00357  ********************************************************************/
00358 // Uncomment these two pragmas for production MAC address
00359 // serialization if using C18. The MACROM=0x1FFF0 statement causes
00360 // the MAC address to be located at aboslute program memory address
00361 // 0x1FFF0 for easy auto-increment without recompiling the stack for
00362 // each device made.  Note, other compilers/linkers use a different
00363 // means of allocating variables at an absolute address.  Check your
00364 // compiler documentation for the right method.
00365 //#pragma romdata MACROM=0x1FFF0
00366 static ROM BYTE SerializedMACAddress[6] = {MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE1, MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE2, MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE3, MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE4, MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE5, MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE6};
00367 //#pragma romdata
00368 
00369 static void InitAppConfig(void)
00370 {
00371 #if (defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM) || defined(MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH)) && (defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2))
00372     BYTE c;
00373     BYTE *p;
00374 #endif
00375 
00376         AppConfig.Flags.bIsDHCPEnabled = TRUE;
00377         AppConfig.Flags.bInConfigMode = TRUE;
00378         memcpypgm2ram((void*)&AppConfig.MyMACAddr, (ROM void*)SerializedMACAddress, sizeof(AppConfig.MyMACAddr));
00379 //      {
00380 //              _prog_addressT MACAddressAddress;
00381 //              MACAddressAddress.next = 0x157F8;
00382 //              _memcpy_p2d24((char*)&AppConfig.MyMACAddr, MACAddressAddress, sizeof(AppConfig.MyMACAddr));
00383 //      }
00384         AppConfig.MyIPAddr.Val = MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE1 | MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE2<<8ul | MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE3<<16ul | MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE4<<24ul;
00385         AppConfig.DefaultIPAddr.Val = AppConfig.MyIPAddr.Val;
00386         AppConfig.MyMask.Val = MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE1 | MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE2<<8ul | MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE3<<16ul | MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE4<<24ul;
00387         AppConfig.DefaultMask.Val = AppConfig.MyMask.Val;
00388         AppConfig.MyGateway.Val = MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE1 | MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE2<<8ul | MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE3<<16ul | MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE4<<24ul;
00389         AppConfig.PrimaryDNSServer.Val = MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE1 | MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE2<<8ul  | MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE3<<16ul  | MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE4<<24ul;
00390         AppConfig.SecondaryDNSServer.Val = MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE1 | MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE2<<8ul  | MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE3<<16ul  | MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE4<<24ul;
00391 
00392         // Load the default NetBIOS Host Name
00393         memcpypgm2ram(AppConfig.NetBIOSName, (ROM void*)MY_DEFAULT_HOST_NAME, 16);
00394         FormatNetBIOSName(AppConfig.NetBIOSName);
00395 
00396 #if defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM) && (defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2))
00397     p = (BYTE*)&AppConfig;
00398 
00399     XEEBeginRead(0x0000);
00400     c = XEERead();
00401     XEEEndRead();
00402 
00403     // When a record is saved, first byte is written as 0x60 to indicate
00404     // that a valid record was saved.  Note that older stack versions
00405         // used 0x57.  This change has been made to so old EEPROM contents
00406         // will get overwritten.  The AppConfig() structure has been changed,
00407         // resulting in parameter misalignment if still using old EEPROM
00408         // contents.
00409     if(c == 0x60u)
00410     {
00411         XEEBeginRead(0x0001);
00412         for ( c = 0; c < sizeof(AppConfig); c++ )
00413             *p++ = XEERead();
00414         XEEEndRead();
00415     }
00416     else
00417         SaveAppConfig();
00418 
00419 #elif defined(MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH) && (defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2))
00420         SPIFlashReadArray(0x00, &c, 1);
00421         if(c == 0x60u)
00422                 SPIFlashReadArray(0x01, (BYTE*)&AppConfig, sizeof(AppConfig));
00423         else
00424                 SaveAppConfig();
00425 #endif
00426 }
00427 
00428 #if (defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM) || defined(MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH)) && (defined(STACK_USE_MPFS) || defined(STACK_USE_MPFS2))
00429 void SaveAppConfig(void)
00430 {
00431         #if defined(MPFS_USE_EEPROM)
00432 
00433     BYTE c;
00434     BYTE *p;
00435 
00436     p = (BYTE*)&AppConfig;
00437     XEEBeginWrite(0x0000);
00438     XEEWrite(0x60);
00439     for ( c = 0; c < sizeof(AppConfig); c++ )
00440     {
00441         XEEWrite(*p++);
00442     }
00443 
00444     XEEEndWrite();
00445 
00446     #else
00447 
00448     SPIFlashBeginWrite(0x0000);
00449     SPIFlashWrite(0x60);
00450     SPIFlashWriteArray((BYTE*)&AppConfig, sizeof(AppConfig));
00451 
00452     #endif
00453 }
00454 #endif
